main event: A civilian, Mrs. Florence A. Avenue, observed a pear-shaped, bright white light in the sky for approximately 5 to 6 minutes on April 18, 1966.
interesting points: The object oscillated and hovered before ascending and disappearing from view., A small light appeared to detach from the main object and descend into the water., The sighting was conducted without the use of optical aids., The observer was a civilian bookkeeper, 35 years old, deemed intelligent and rational., No physical evidence of the sighting was found upon investigation.
witness description: Mrs. Florence A. Avenue, a 35-year-old bookkeeper, seems intelligent, well-educated and rational.
